title: Startup agency is selling a home a day
text:
But while Purplebricks positioned itself squarely as an outsider at war with the traditional commission model and the industry establishment, Upside is a member of the NSW and Victorian real estate institutes.

‘‘We support the industry bodies. We are not bagging the industry. We want to disrupt in a positive manner,’’ Mr Rigby said.

It has also adopted a different approach to recruitment and remuneration – a major Achilles heel for Purplebricks, which battled a continual revolving door of disgruntled agents, many of whom struggled to earn a living from their meagre split of the fixed-fee.

Shaking up the industry

Upside real estate agents are full-time employees of the company and are paid a monthly wage with the ability to earn bonuses based on sales success.

This strategy, assisted by an improving housing market, appears to be bearing fruit.

Upside has sold 369 homes in the 12 months to the end of September – 243 in the last six months – on a modest advertising budget.

At the height of its growth, Purplebricks was spending more than 80¢ in advertising and marketing for every dollar in revenue it earned, including a national television and radio campaign.

Advertisement

While this media saturation delivered more than 6200 sales, it meant Purplebricks never came close to breaking even, a key reason why it quit Australia after less than three years.

"Too heavy a focus on TV advertising and not enough on good agents, relationship building and sales management was a key reason that Purplebricks failed," Mr Rigby said.

Another factor was the dip in the housing market, which meant homes took longer to sell, a key metric for a business model reliant on a high volume of sales.

While Upside may benefit from the turnaround in the housing market, Mr Rigby said he believed the fixed-fee model was sustainable during downturns as well.

"We have no shopfronts. Those can cost $100,000 a month," he highlighted as one example of its advantages.

Having started in Melbourne, Geelong and the Mornington Peninsula, Upside recently commenced operations in Sydney, Brisbane, Canberra and the Gold Coast.

"We are shaking up the industry through a fair and transparent service," Mr Rigby said.
description: Upside Realty has recruited 43 agents and the real estate start-up expects to become profitable by October next year.
